TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HierarchyBranch extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlLeafElement

summary.para: This class is available in Office 2007 and above.
When the object is serialized out as xml, it's qualified name is dgm:hierBranch.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)] **hierBranch (Organization Chart Branch Style)** This element defines the layout style of a branch in an organizational chart. [*Example*: Consider the following example of hierBranch being used in DiagramML: ```xml ``` In this example the value of hierBranch is defined as *init* which is a kind of not set state, or initial state. *end example*] |Parent Elements| |---------------------| |presLayoutVars (§21.4.5.4); varLst (§21.4.2.31)| |Attributes|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |val (Organization Chart Branch Style Value)|The value of this attribute indicates the layout style of a branch in an organization chart. The default value is *std*.

The possible values for this attribute are defined by the *ST_HierBranchStyle* simple type (§21.4.7.37).| [*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_HierBranchStyle) is located in §A.5.3. *end note*] [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]

Public Overrides Function CloneNode (deep As Boolean) As OpenXmlElement

Docs.param: true to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; false to clone only the node itself.
Docs.summary: Creates a duplicate of this node.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Val As EnumValue(Of HierarchyBranchStyleValues)

summary.para: Represents the following attribute in the schema: val

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following information from the ECMA International [Standard ECMA-376](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-376.htm) can be useful when working with this class.
The value of this attribute indicates the layout style of a branch in an organization chart. The default value is `std`.
The possible values for this attribute are defined by the `ST_HierBranchStyle` simple type.
